body: |- wceq(clgs, cmpo(s0, s1, cz, cz, cif(cif(nat1, nat0, wceq(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), nat1)), co(cif(cneg(nat1), nat1, wa(wbr(cv(s1), clt, nat0), wbr(cv(s0), clt, nat0))), cmul, cfv(cseq(nat1, cmul, cmpt(s2, cn, cif(co(cif(cif(nat0, cif(nat1, cneg(nat1), wcel(co(cv(s0), cmo, nat8), cpr(nat1, nat7))), wbr(nat2, cdvds, cv(s0))), co(co(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, co(co(cv(s2), cmin, nat1), cdiv, nat2)), caddc, nat1), cmo, cv(s2)), cmin, nat1), wceq(cv(s2), nat2)), cexp, co(cv(s2), cpc, cv(s1))), nat1, wcel(cv(s2), cprime)))), cfv(cabs, cv(s1)))), wceq(cv(s1), nat0))))
comment: Define the Legendre symbol (actually the Kronecker symbol, which extends the Legendre symbol to all integers, and also the Jacobi symbol, which restricts the Kronecker symbol to positive odd integers). See definition in [ApostolNT] p. 179 resp. definition in [ApostolNT] p. 188. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Feb-2015.)
